website_summaries.verdict: A stunning photographic guide that offers comprehensive descriptions of bird species – best suited to advanced birders.
pros: Features 3,400 photographs of 854 species of North American birds
Filled with information, from flight patterns and migration areas to feather length
Features several pictures of each species
Includes a CD with 600 bird songs
cons: The guide is heavy and bulky
not really great for the field
Maps are on the small side, making them hard to read
Not the best guide for beginners

customer_reviews.title: I really like that there are several high quality photos of each ...
customer_reviews.text: Most comprehensive bird book I have in my library. I really like that there are several high quality photos of each bird, making it easier to see normal variations within the each species. I have bought several copies of this book and given them as gifts to other bird-enthusiast friends. And the CD with the bird songs is an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl W.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT book!
customer_reviews.text: We have so many birds that I have not been able to find in the Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Birds so my husband surprised me by order this book! Many beautiful photos of male and female in their winter and summer plumage. We have finally been able to identify the many new birds that have been stopping through! He and I both enjoy the book very much and keep it right by our patio door where I have several different feeder!
customer_reviews.author: LaBreck

customer_reviews.title: Nice book
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures! I like that it shows all the variations of the birds when they differ in color because of age or sex. This would not be a good field book, as it is heavy. However, it is fine for birdwatching in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Girl

customer_reviews.title: The choice
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased five different field guides for birding to update and expand our references and this is my favorite. I am glad to have them all but a friend had this so I ordered it first and then ordered others just to get more info and to compare what is available. I ended up thinking that I am glad to have the others to look at but if I had to choose just one, this would be my choice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fahle

customer_reviews.title: Book great, CD not great
customer_reviews.text: The book is great however the bird sounds CD was a let down. I tried to listen to it in my car and there is no sound. It will not work. Bummer because long drives would of been a perfect time to study bird communication 🙁
customer_reviews.author: LjL

customer_reviews.title: Best Bird Identification Reference
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted this product by a friend (with a PhD in wildlife biology) when I was looking for a serious bird identification source. I’ve since gifted two other folks who needed a good reference. It is beautifully illustrated, easy to use and the CD with bird calls is a wonderful addition! Makes our home birding experience so much more enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great for Newbies
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for novice bird watchers. The way the book is organized makes it very easy to identify the type of bird you're looking at, the gender and age, whether it is a permanent resident or a visitor, even it's rarity. The book has a permanent home on the windowsill that overlooks the feeder. We'll worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Pics.
customer_reviews.text: Full of pictures and information. Would have given it 5 stars but I wish it would list what type of food is common for each species, i.e.... mostly small seed eaters or insect hunters etc..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a big hit as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift along with binoculars for family member. Got this Stokes version as a recommendation from a personal friend who rehabs raptors and has extensive knowledge on bird watching. Has a CD in the back cover included with samples of what different birds sound like. You might be able to entice another like bird to your area by playing the bird of your choice in while watching for the birds. Good quality pages with color pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures made identifiying birds easy
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the Audubon Field Guide for years to identify our "back yard" birds. It's well worn and soon to be replaced. This winter I ordered the Stokes book on a whim. The multiple pictures of each species with very accurate colors make identifying the many similar small birds a breeze. In the last two days I have been able to identify three birds I was unable to determine with the Audubon guide because of the inaccurate color or poor quality of the photos. I find this book is a bit more difficult to navigate, but the results are worth the extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Upperfish

customer_reviews.title: Newbie Bird Watching
customer_reviews.text: Large variety of pictures and the habitat/migratory maps are super helpful in narrowing down identification. Great resource for starting our bird watching hobby!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: great photos of birds
customer_reviews.text: Easy to recognize photos of types of birds along with development stages. Much better than drawings. Great information.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brice

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book because it has actual photos rather than drawings & there's usually several photos of the same type of bird. I don't know a lot about birds so it can be a bit challenging to look them up since they are listed by their categories. I think they are listed in decreasing sizes so I've been able to narrow down a category that way most of the time. I keep this book on my coffee table where it is handy & I can quickly grab it when a bird shows up that I don't recognize it. Having acutal photos makes all the difference!! My other bird book is on the shelf!
customer_reviews.author: LFL8812

customer_reviews.title: GREAT birthday gift for the bird lover
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my sister for her birthday...along with sketching pencils and a sketch pad. SHE LOVED them!
customer_reviews.author: ewiz

customer_reviews.title: Layperson’s Colorful Bird Encyclopedia
customer_reviews.text: I use this book for window birdwatching. It is simple and great for myself and other visitors to my home. It is a great conversation piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Walters

customer_reviews.title: Best bird book ever
customer_reviews.text: This book, with full color photos in many different positions, really helps me to identify the birds in our back yard. Most recently, we had a hawk visiting which turned out to be a red-shouldered hawk. Another time I saw a very strange looking robin, which turned out to be a juvenile. I also gave this book to three of my relatives who love bird watching. It's really wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Avian Identification
customer_reviews.text: It is only a matter of time that most birders will have eBird or another similar electronic app that they will use for serious in-field birding. This book is a bit hefty, but the contents are fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Boyle, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This guide is organized by bird color. It is easy to use. There is a lot of information on each bird. Good photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bird book
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about this book is the actual pictures of birds. Pictures make identifying the birds a lot easier than drawings. The information provided about the different birds, habitat, migration, maps etc. was also very helpful. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I have this book and liked it so much I bought it for a family member who lives on a different coast. This is great in the sense that we can share different birds we have seen in each other's area.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: One Word: AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Stokes Field Guide to the Birds of North America is an amazing 791-paged book, one of the most thorough, mesmerizing, and wondrous books to ever be published on birds. The book examines many classic species (as well as some rarer ones), and provides stunning photographs throughout. While there are a lot of other good field guides out there, this one is friendly for both the experienced birder and the novice, inasmuch as there is something for everyone here! Donald and Lillian Stokes have given a true gift of passion and dedication to bird-lovers everywhere! As a bonus, the CD that comes with is also fantastic. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: Lots of information for the new bird watcher. Plus it comes with a CD of 150 different bird songs
customer_reviews.author: LGB

customer_reviews.title: Great for birdwatchers. Easily identifies birds
customer_reviews.text: Got this book for my dad, he lives in woods and watches birds. This book hasn’t let him down in identifying the birds he sees! He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stokes/Birds of N. America
customer_reviews.text: I received this book in just a couple of days in perfect condition just as it was advertised. I knew from other reviews this book had photos rather than sketches/paintings of birds. Even though the photos are great, I think this book in addition to one of the books with paintings(Sibley or Peterson)would be helpful. That is the reason for 4 rather than 5 stars, not the lack of any quality. The lay-out and bird info is great. Also this book is a little larger and thicker than other "handbooks". Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: buffalo sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource, thorough details
customer_reviews.text: Excellent resource, thorough details, great photography and selection of photos (often showing several stages/plumages, which really helps for identification). I'm really pleased with it. It's a little harder to find a bird if you don't know what it is or what family it would be in, but the better pictures help and make up for that. Great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Clark

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but needs clearer photos of various species.
customer_reviews.text: A very informative book, although the photos can be small and not show the markings clearly enough to discern the species of our neighborhood hawk.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: You have room for this one!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent help for bird identification. Lots of photos of same bird at different times of year, in different lighting, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Athene

customer_reviews.title: Great photos, easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a NEW backyarder bird watcher! Great photos, easy to read, migration maps and birding info appreciated! Gift was well received! TY
customer_reviews.author: pinc

customer_reviews.title: Very good book..
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two earlier editions of Stokes Guide to Eastern Birds, so was excited to purchased this new edition.. This is, by far, their best book yet.. This book has many more images of the various birds than their previous editions..This book gives images of the various birds in different stages of plumage and in different times of the year... I have always liked actual photographs of birds compared to drawings and illustrations..A very good Bird Identification guide. Oh, and did I mention the free CD of 150 different bird songs that is included with this book... Very Nice..
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: enjoy birds
customer_reviews.text: This book helps me identify the birds I see very nice
customer_reviews.author: Loretta L.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This book is highly recommended because it not only shows the adult bird but the different stages from fledgling to adult and its colors. This helps so people do not think they have a species of bird other than what it is. Stokes did it again! I showed it to a friend and she is going to get it as she gets literally hundreds of birds that come to her home feeders. Recommend this book highly to any bird enthusiast or beginning learner.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Solid Guide plus California Condor!
customer_reviews.text: Includes California Condor, omitted in the most recent western regional edition. Solid reference and photo guide, bonus CD is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: Very imformative book for those who bird or just those who question. Have been using Stokes and Petersen forever and am very happy with the quality of photos and information.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Geren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Being an amateur birder this book has been just what I hoped to get and learn from.
customer_reviews.author: SwissPete

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Photos & Descriptions!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book because of the great photos & the CD that comes with it. The CD has over 600 sounds from 150 different birds! The sounds are longer than most clips (averaging around a minute) and this allows you to hear multiple sounds, from one bird. I love the CD! The photos & descriptions are very well done. I've always had a hard time finding good photos of predater birds(i.e hawks)but this one does well :) Great book, but a bit heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome seller. Delivery quicker than expected! Great price! Greatest bird book on the market!!!
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Great book with wonderful pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great book with wonderful pictures. I’m new at birding and this book helps me to find birds by using the real pictures to identify.
customer_reviews.author: D. Linn

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for my first birding field trip with professional birders in my state. I love the various descriptions of the birds and the identifying details. I had never realized there were so many colorful birds that migrate and breed in my local area until I discovered this book and more about birding. This is the perfect gift for bird lovers. I love this book.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide
customer_reviews.text: A fine book and the cd is an extra that is a wonderful addition
customer_reviews.author: Hertzel Grotch

customer_reviews.title: Great guide.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible book. I think it's the best photo guide out there.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S.

customer_reviews.title: Bird guide using actual pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is a large heavy book not suited to be used as a field guide. That said, it's filled with the most precise and wonderful photos. Nice adjunct to the typical guide that provides drawings. I've always preferred the drawings but the Stokes book has changed my mind about this. Again too large and heavy for a field guide but a great addition to your birding book collection.
customer_reviews.author: Alpine Annie

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bird guides on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guid with beautiful photos to help in identification! Has to be one of my favorite bird guides!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing. The amount of birds is almost overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Cameo

customer_reviews.title: Good for old people
customer_reviews.text: Got for my retired dad he needs a hobby he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: easy to use bird guide
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be my favorite bird guide, easy to use and very complete.
customer_reviews.author: Ardine M. Martinelli

customer_reviews.title: Birds
customer_reviews.text: I have there other books so I have included there North American book also. I have there Eastern and there Western bird books probably didn't need this one but can through it in my motorcycle when were vacationing. These are the best bird books to buy. I have done my home work. Best pictures you will love there books.
customer_reviews.author: Larry keith

customer_reviews.title: Variety of picture angles of birds
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of photos of in flight and stationary birds.
customer_reviews.author: R. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very nice field guide. I wish there was some more detailed information about them though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, the book was much more complete than I was expecting. Pleasantly surprised. My mine year old son and I have enjoyed using the book to look up birds we see on our hikes and find out more information about them. The included CD of bird songs was a great bonus, though a little disappointing that it is in mp3 format and won't play in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Hayward

customer_reviews.title: The only book you will need
customer_reviews.text: This is a very extensive guide filled with a lot of photos. I was unsure about purchasing a field guide online without being able to flip through it but it was exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Worth having this book
customer_reviews.text: All the Stokes books are excellent, with good info and great photos.
customer_reviews.author: kitplanesue

customer_reviews.title: This guide belongs in YOUR nest
customer_reviews.text: I have been so anxious to get my hands on this guide.....It came tonight, and I am very impressed with it,so far! it IS chunky...perhaps best as a home guide, or in your car.However,that withstanding,this is a gem! Plenty of pix,and info.Very well organized.I have never been disappointed by a Stokes guide, and this one will become my favorite, I am sure of it!
customer_reviews.author: B.Morgan

customer_reviews.title: nice book, easy to find birds, good pictures.
customer_reviews.text: My family has always been looking at backyard birds and enjoying feeding birds for generations. So I wanted a nice bird book when I got a home with a nice bird feeder. I selected this one based on the reviews and I am happy as the pictures really help - such as downy vs hairy woodpeckers. I use it often and mark off the birds I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schutte

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have this book at work and at home. I work for Texas State Parks
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Good bird guide...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife. She has started to "get into" bird feeders and bird watching so I bought her this to help her ID some of the birds that she was seeing at her feeders. It has a lot of good information and some really beautiful photos of the birds. My wife loved it so I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Book with 1 concern
customer_reviews.text: Received this book and was mesmerized. Wonderful photos and descriptions. Being a bird nerd, I found that the book is too large and heavy (almost 3 pounds)for carrying in the field. I will keep it in my vehicle for an excellent reference source.
customer_reviews.author: imatwicker

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide to Birds of N. America
customer_reviews.text: An outstanding guide, the many pictures of birds with different molting conditions as well as the pithy comments make this guide an essential for birders. The section on Gulls alone makes this worthwhile. It is a big heavy book so hauling it along on a hike is unlikely but leave it handy in the car. Well worth waiting the 14 years since their last effort.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mishell

customer_reviews.title: great bird book
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the MANY bird books we have around the house. It is well thought-out and put together. However, it is not a book for the field. It is too big and heavy. It is a perfect reference for the den. A beautiful book, but unless you have someone else carry it for you, you will leave it at home.
customer_reviews.author: Spyder B

customer_reviews.title: Nice book for a gift.
customer_reviews.text: Good photos. We like that each bird has multiple photos and almost always photos showing juvenile stages as well as summer/winter.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy my book!!
customer_reviews.text: Good birding book,pictures are really good I bought one for myself liked it well enough that I bought another one for our friends for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: TIM BREWER

customer_reviews.title: the cd is nice and i can upload this to my bird caller
customer_reviews.text: almost 800 pages with very stunning photography on each page. the cd is nice and i can upload this to my bird caller. really like this book. carl
customer_reviews.author: Carlton G. Rockwood Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good bird book
customer_reviews.text: Really like the substantial photos of birds. This has to be one of the best bird i.d. books out there.
customer_reviews.author: grandma barb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photos, range maps and descriptions
customer_reviews.text: A must have guide to birds of North America. Excellent photos, range maps and descriptions. A bit heavy to carry in the field but definitely the one you will want at home. Includes CD with large selection of bird songs in mp3 format.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Complete Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pictures of the birds: standing, in flight, mature and imature, male and female. It also includes a CD of bird songs.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel4

customer_reviews.title: More like an encyclopedia
customer_reviews.text: Ok book, but too much info. More like an encyclopedia.
customer_reviews.author: CAdams

customer_reviews.title: If you Like Birds Get This Book
customer_reviews.text: I throughly enjoy this book. I have bought several bird books from amazon.com and enjoy all of these books. The other books are Birds of North America, Dunn & Alderfer, Wetland Birds, Leslie, Bird Guide of North America for kids Alderfer all excellent books
customer_reviews.author: Clara Megan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent job!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of a photograph based field guide (Audubon's version is horrible) so I bought this book with worry that I was throwing money away. I was very wrong and this book is now a mainstay along with Sibley. I find myself reaching for this guide more often than not. Do yourself a favor and grab this book..it is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome bird book!
customer_reviews.text: Pages and pages of pictures so that you can see the birds from several different angles. This is an incredible book for identifying birds and it even had a bonus CD with different bird sounds. I was very happy to find out it is such a well written book.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: Bonus CD of Bird Songs Included
customer_reviews.text: This book has been on my watch list since its release; moreover,the reasonable price on Amazon Prime made it a dream come true. It is by far one of the best field guides on North American Birds to date. It's CD of bird songs makes it a must investment for all bird lovers
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Great book with lots and lots and lots of pictures and descriptions. I got this book after watching The Big Year and it's really gotten me into birding. My son likes to look through it to see all the birds. Very informational.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Best field guide I own. Only criticism would be that it doesn't fit in a normal pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Heilman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Pictures, excellent descriptions, and a sweet surprise.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this item as a Christmas gift for my mother and am now thinking of ordering a second for our home. The pictures are a lovely selection, and the descriptions are nicely detailed (without being too lengthy). I only wish it had pictures of the nests, eggs, and chicks. *As a surprise bonus there is a CD of over 600 bird sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Manda

customer_reviews.title: Excited for this book!
customer_reviews.text: This book is heavy and has more information than I thought it would, but I am super excited to give this away as a gift to my Dad. It looks like the perfect book for a bird watcher of any degree! I couldn't believe the amount of pictures throughout the book, and it also has a bonus CD with bird sounds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rohrbaugh

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have many field guide to birds. I bought this one as a gift because I love mine -- I have two written by Stokes -- North America and Eastern region. pix are different in each. Best thing is that they give much info including several pictures of birds at different seasons.
customer_reviews.author: MLM Luy

customer_reviews.title: Great book, great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I saw this book at the Grand Canyon, and bought it as soon as I got home. Great book, great pictures, accurate information, and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Triple Moon Goddess Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Teaching kids about birds
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to teach my young son about the birds at our backyard feeders. It’s an exceptional text, and we’re enjoying our father-son time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bird identifying book!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. I can now identify every bird in my backyard and on trips. Great descriptions and pictures. Well written.
customer_reviews.author: Lou-Lou

customer_reviews.title: A lot of photographs to help identify the birds. ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot of photographs to help identify the birds. There is also a page at the cover to help index the birds by type.
customer_reviews.author: Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Handy Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: Good handbook for identifying most species of birds. I recently relocated from New York City to western North Carolina and can now identify the many varieties of birds in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Gruenhut

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Great pictures and love the cd.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reference book
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to this location and as usual, wanted to identify the birds in our yard. This is a very good reference guide, with excellent photos, descriptions, and explanations of where the birds live, and migrate to and from. I would recommend it to any one needing a home reference guide on birds. It gives information on the differences between female and male bird markings of the same species. A very helpful guide.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Stokes - Birds
customer_reviews.text: This book is just a wonderful guide for someone fairly new to bird watching, like me. The pictures are a great representation of the diversity within each type of bird, as well as between male and female birds. I would highly recommend this book to anyone breaking into bird watching as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: casual reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource
customer_reviews.text: Good addition to the birders library. It's really nice to see high quality pictures versus colored artwork. Since both have their pros and cons, one should have both formats for more comprehensive information.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Birding Book
customer_reviews.text: I am new to "birding", and I am normally using a camera with 70-300mm lens on my Canon xsi. The color photos in the book are excellent to use when I am looking at my bird photos as I download them to my computer. As time goes by I learn the names of the various birds, but when I see a particular bird for the first time and I then search the Stokes book and find the photo that ID's the "unknown to me" bird, it is exciting!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Bird Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Great book. We have owned at least 3 other bird field guides and this one is #1. Great photos and information. The bird songs CD was a nice extra.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Coelho

customer_reviews.title: Handy & Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Great, easy to carry, reference book for birders, or beginning birders!
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: All pictures no drawings. One of the best guides I own!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great deal gently used........
customer_reviews.text: This book was like new and came with the CD. I was able to identify new birds visiting my feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Badlin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mother who is an avid bird watcher! She LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: ms73169

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mothers birthday because she loves birds. The pages are beautiful, informative and very durable. The CD is a great help too. I would recommend this for anyone who needs a bird book, whatever the reason.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna W.

customer_reviews.title: Stokes Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Stokes Field Guide. I have spent hours looking through it. I like that all the information you need for each bird is all on one page.
customer_reviews.author: 778mn

customer_reviews.title: very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: book came on time and in a-1 shape, very happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Stokes Field Guide to Birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: Very good photographs of all the birds along with good write-ups describing their habits and habitats. Beautifully compiled and organized, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Rockett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: will be great for watching our birds at the feeder
customer_reviews.author: Janette Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a newby to birding and I find this so easy to use. Yep, it is heavy, but it is wonderful. I'm having a ball with it.
customer_reviews.author: Feminist Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Stokes bird guide.
customer_reviews.text: This book is much better than the last one I bought, as all the pictures are photos rather than drawings. Much easier to ID the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to my library
customer_reviews.text: I have shelves of birding books. This new Stokes is spectacular. The pictures are clear and detailed. The format is easy to understand. The info is relevant. To a novice or expert, this is a must addition to one's library
customer_reviews.author: S. dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: If you love birds get this book. The pictures make it easy to identify birds. I would have liked a little more information regarding nesting & eating habits though.
customer_reviews.author: Dee A. Marfe

customer_reviews.title: Good reference
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much, but it seems to be a great book.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: The one almanac I need in the US.
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended by an experienced birder. The almanac covers everything that I expect I can see in this continent, and it provides a comprehensive account of all the species at some details. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: The Stokes Field Guide to the Birds of North America (Stokes Field Guides)

specifications.Publisher: Little, Brown and Company; Original Edition (October 25, 2010)
